headline.main: NEW CURBS ORDERED ON SMOKING IN FEDERAL OFFICES

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Government today told its agency heads that they must provide a ''reasonably smoke-free environment'' on the job. While not a ban on smoking, the directive from the General Services Administration represents a major shift from present policy, and it reflects growing momentum for curbs on smoking around the nation. An antismoking activist who hailed the move said it covered more people than any similar action before. The General Services Administration is in charge of 7,500 buildings, housing almost the entire civilian Government work force of 2.3 million people.
